title: 108_s1707
content: The Act titled "Providing Our Support to Troops Act of 2003" grants free mailing privileges to troops. The "Providing Our Support to Troops Act of 2003" allows free postage for personal correspondence and certain parcels mailed to members of the Armed Forces of the United States. The "Providing Our Support to Troops Act of 2003" grants free mailing privileges for personal correspondence and parcels up to 10 pounds in weight to members of the Armed Forces stationed overseas or hospitalized due to service-related issues. The "Providing Our Support to Troops Act of 2003" grants free mailing privileges for personal correspondence and parcels up to 10 pounds in weight to members of the Armed Forces stationed overseas or hospitalized due to service-related issues. The free mailing privilege does not extend to mail matter containing advertising and must be mailed at the equivalent rate of postage for economical means. All mail under this section must be marked with "Free Matter for Members of the Armed Forces of the United States" in the address area. This section is administered under regulations set by the Postal Service and the Secretary of Defense. The "Providing Our Support to Troops Act of 2003" grants free mailing privileges for personal correspondence and parcels up to 10 pounds in weight to members of the Armed Forces stationed overseas or hospitalized due to service-related issues. The act also authorizes appropriations for the Postal Service to cover expenses incurred in providing air transportation for mail sent to members of the Armed Forces free of postage. The "Providing Our Support to Troops Act of 2003" grants free mailing privileges for personal correspondence and parcels up to 10 pounds in weight to members of the Armed Forces stationed overseas or hospitalized due to service-related issues. The act also authorizes appropriations for the Postal Service to cover expenses incurred in providing air transportation for mail sent to members of the Armed Forces at the same postage rate. Amendments are made to prevent duplicative funding and technical and conforming amendments are also included. Sections 2803(a) and 2804(a) of title 39 are amended by changing "2401(g)" to "2401(f)." The analysis for chapter 34 of title 39, United States Code, is updated with additional information. Free postage is provided for personal correspondence and certain parcels mailed to Members of the Armed Forces of the United States.
